metadata.feature_description: Compare analytics data between two different time periods to identify trends

steps.action: Navigated to Community Analytics via PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard loads with comparative term selector visible
steps.actual: Community Analytics dashboard loaded successfully with Comparative Term dropdown showing options: 1 y, 1 m, 1 w

steps.action: Verified comparative term dropdown options and changed from 1 w to 1 m
steps.expected: Dashboard updates to show comparison with previous month
steps.actual: Dashboard updated successfully, showing current period metrics alongside Comparative Term metrics for 1 month comparison

steps.action: Changed comparative term from 1 m to 1 y
steps.expected: Dashboard updates to show comparison with previous year
steps.actual: Dashboard updated successfully, showing current period metrics alongside Comparative Term metrics for 1 year comparison

steps.action: Examined Community Health cards for percentage display
steps.expected: Each metric card shows current percentage and comparative term percentage
steps.actual: Each Community Health metric card displays current percentage (e.g., '0%') alongside 'Comparative Term' label with percentage value

steps.action: Verified percentage display format across different modules
steps.expected: Consistent percentage formatting with superscript '%' symbol
steps.actual: All metric cards show percentages in consistent format with superscript '%' symbol for both current and comparative values

steps.action: Examined Community Health cards for trend indicator icons
steps.expected: Green star icons indicate positive trend, red icons indicate negative trend
steps.actual: Green star icons visible on all Community Health metric cards indicating positive/neutral status. Code analysis confirms percent-progress CSS classes support 'higher' and 'lower' states for trend direction

steps.action: Reviewed code for trend indicator implementation
steps.expected: Code shows logic for determining up/down trends based on data comparison
steps.actual: Code in social-dashboard.html confirms trend indicators use CSS classes: 'higher' for positive, 'lower' for negative, 'hidden' for equal values via percentProgress observable

steps.action: Verified API endpoints pass comparativeTerm parameter for calculations
steps.expected: API endpoints accept comparativeTerm parameter and return calculated comparison data
steps.actual: CommunityAnalyticsController.cs confirms all endpoints (GetDashboardInfo, GetModuleDashboardInfo, etc.) accept comparativeTerm parameter and delegate to AnalyticsController for calculations

steps.action: Verified consistent calculation display across modules
steps.expected: Same metrics show consistent values when switching between modules
steps.actual: Engagement (0%), Creates (0), Views (0) values display consistently across all module tabs (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki)

steps.action: Navigated to Ideas module which has metrics without applicable previous data
steps.expected: System displays N/A for metrics where comparison is not applicable
steps.actual: Ideas module correctly displays 'N/A' for metrics like 'Ideas without change in status in over 2 weeks' and 'Ideas without change in company response in over 30 days' for both current and Comparative Term values

steps.action: Verified N/A display for both current and comparative term columns
steps.expected: N/A displayed consistently in both comparison columns
steps.actual: N/A label shown in both current value area and Comparative Term section for non-applicable metrics, confirming proper handling of missing/incomparable data

steps.action: Verified comparative term options available for different period types
steps.expected: Comparative term dropdown offers different options (1 y, 1 m, 1 w) that adapt to selected period
steps.actual: Comparative Term dropdown consistently shows all three options: '1 y' (1 year), '1 m' (1 month), '1 w' (1 week) across all modules

steps.action: Switched between different modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) to verify period comparison functionality
steps.expected: Each module maintains independent comparative term selection and displays appropriate comparison data
steps.actual: All six modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) visible with independent navigation. Each module displays Community Health metrics with Comparative Term section showing percentage comparisons

steps.action: Verified date range (2 Feb 2026 - 8 Feb 2026) displays consistently
steps.expected: Current date range shown in period selector
steps.actual: Date range '2 Feb 2026 - 8 Feb 2026' displayed consistently in period selector across all modules

observations: The Comparative Analytics feature is fully integrated into the Community Analytics dashboard with a dropdown selector for comparative term periods
Code analysis of analytics.js confirms comparative terms mapping: 'Year': '1 y', 'Month': '1 m', 'Week': '1 w', 'Day': '1 d'
The CommunityAnalyticsController.cs uses IAnalyticsController to handle all comparison calculations server-side
N/A handling is properly implemented in social-dashboard.html using Knockout.js 'isNA' observable for metrics without applicable comparative data
Trend indicators use CSS classes (higher/lower/hidden) to show visual direction of metric changes between periods
All testing was performed with zero data in the database, which correctly displays 0% for all numeric metrics and N/A for non-applicable comparisons
The Custom period option is also available but hides the comparative term dropdown when selected (as designed)
